data.title: Excellent
data.text: The food is great!  I love their turkey pest grilled cheese and burrito de pueblo but they are only offered as daily specials.  My favorite everyday option is the Sweet Caroline wrap.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: They have lots to choose from and a special each day along with a soup each day.  I have had lunch there quite a few times and always find everything great.  Nothing to complain about.  The wraps, sandwiches, santa fe salad and buffalo baked potato all have been good. The dill dip and chips they give you with you sandwich is really good too.  You can eat there or carry out.

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: This is a great place to grab lunch.  It's fairly quiet, the staff is friendly and the sandwiches are outstanding.  I love the hippie chicken wrap.  The dill dip that comes with the chips is tasty too.

data.title: Fantastic lunch spot.  Addictive soups & sandwiches!
data.text:
This place has some of the most imaginative food, very nicely made.  The owner is a really nice, friendly, down to earth guy who obviously has a knack for whipping up very tasty recipes.  I have unsuccessfully tried to recreate his addictive creamy spinach artichoke soup myself.  That stuff is ambrosia.  The wraps & quesadillas are phenomenal, as is the house made dill dip for the kettle chips they serve.  They have a chicken wrap with Carolina mustard sauce, bacon & onions that is one of the best sandwiches I've had the pleasure of eating!  The quesadillas are always nicely grilled til the outside is good & toasty.  The Italian Stallion is one I recommend.  I love the clever names they come up with!

The in house baker makes marvelous, fresh baked good every day & his specialty is scones.  They are fantastic!!  They also sell locally made, vegan treats, such as espresso twinkles.  Really!!  Quite good.  

Even if you aren't a coffee drinker, Ohio Coffee Co has such great food that you won't regret going there.  They're located on the ground floor of the large office building on the southwest corner of third/main in downtown Dayton.  I believe it's the 5/3 building.  There is underground parking, which I very strongly recommend if you're driving there, so as to avoid the parking meter gestapo and gauntlet of thugs that sometimes envelop the area.

data.title: Coffee and more
data.text: This is a great place to sit and enjoy a really good latte.  The price is right, the people are nice and the coffee is to die for!
